intro: Chiococca pinetorum, commonly known as the pine tree coca, is a woody plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Chiococca pinetorum is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils.
